utterances: Can you provide me with more information about what courses are included in the curriculum for this program?
What is the curriculum for the program?
answers: The program includes subjects such as business intelligence, data analytics, project management and agility, programming using Java, software analysis and design, and the option to study either French or English as a foreign language. Additionally, the curriculum includes courses that focus on personal and professional development, research workshops, and term projects. In the second year, students have the opportunity to take a variety of elective courses, such as innovative software methods, innovative data management, cybersecurity, internet of things and web development, advanced artificial intelligence, sustainable information systems, and user interface and user experience design.

The curriculum for the program includes courses in business intelligence, data analytics, project management and agility, advanced programming in Java, software analysis and design, and foreign language (French or English). It also includes professionalization courses in soft skills and personal development, research workshops, and term projects. In the second year, students can choose from a range of courses in innovative software methods, innovative data management, cybersecurity, internet of things and web development, advanced topics in artificial intelligence, sustainable information systems, and user interface and user experience.

utterances: People in charge of the program
answers: 1st year: David Simoncini <david.simoncini@ut-capitole.fr>, maître de conférences, 2nd year: Chihab Hanachi <Chihab.Hanachi@ut-capitole.fr>, professeur des universités

utterances: What are the goals of the program
Who is this program designed for
answers: The 2IS Master program is designed for Bachelor students in information technologies (IT) aiming to expand their knowledge on innovative information technologies. 2IS is organised by researchers of IRIT (Institut de Recherche en Informatique de Toulouse), one of the major French institutes in computer science. 2IS is a MIAGE Master program (Méthodes Informatiques Appliquées à la Gestion des Entreprises), which is the reference Master in France for information technolgy. MIAGE programs are run by more than 20 universities in France. Innovative information technologies reinvent and transform businesses. Artificial intelligence, big data and web-service orchestration drastically impact end-users as automation is at the heart of business processes.

The 2IS Master program is tailored for IT Bachelor students who wish to enhance their understanding of cutting-edge information technologies. It is organized by IRIT (Institut de Recherche en Informatique de Toulouse), a leading French institute in computer science. 2IS is part of the MIAGE Master program (Méthodes Informatiques Appliquées à la Gestion des Entreprises), a widely recognized program in France for IT. MIAGE programs are offered by over 20 universities in France. Innovative information technologies play a critical role in shaping and transforming businesses, with areas such as artificial intelligence, big data and web-service orchestration having significant impact on end-users as automation becomes increasingly central to business processes.

The 2IS program offers a comprehensive and unique view of innovation in information technology over a 2-year period, covering topics such as innovative software solutions, software development methods, and innovation and entrepreneurship in strategy and management. These include business intelligence and data visualization, machine learning, collective intelligence, distributed databases, agile management, and collaborative design.

It is possible to spend part of the studies abroad, depending on the exchange programs in place between the University of Toulouse 1 Capitole and other EU or foreign countries. Applications and selections will be conducted the year before the exchange period. Make contact with the International Relations Office of the University if interested. <https://www.ut-capitole.fr/accueil/universite/gouvernance/services-administratifs-et-techniques/service-commun-des-relations-europeennes-et-internationales-1>

utterances: Are internships or practical experience opportunities available as part of the program?
Will I be able to gain real-world experience?
Are there any opportunities for hands-on learning?
answers: Yes, there is an internship opportunity available in the fourth semester, which is a 5-month internship in a company followed by a final examination.

1st year: the internship is not compulsory, 2nd year: The internship is compulsory (5-month). The relationship between the student, the company and the university must always be defined by an Internship Agreement.
Download the full information sheet using: https://www.ut-capitole.fr/medias/fichier/mastermiage-2is-2022-2023_1666706582840-pdf?ID_FICHE=33372&INLINE=FALSE

answers: The program is on-campus.

To enrol you must hold a Bachelor in Information Technologies or an equivalent title (minimum 3 years of study), as well as a certification of English proficiency at B2 level.

utterances: how much doe this program cost
how much money do i need
answers: Tuiton fees are about 250 euros per year (as an excellence program the Master 2IS does not apply the differential fees for foreign students). For all details consult the webpage of the international relation office. <https://www.ut-capitole.fr/international-/international-student-registration-fees-838362.kjsp>

utterances: What kind of financial aid or scholarships are available for the program?
Are there any grants or scholarships available?
Can I get any financial assistance to attend the program?
answers: Our university does not provide scolarships nor student accommodation. Eiffel scolarships are available at national level, the internal deadline is usually in November of the previous year. A prize of around 500 euros is awarded by the Faculty of IT to first-class students during the first year of the master.

utterances: how much does it cost to live in toulouse
answers: Living costs in Toulouse are around 800€ per month, with accommodation costing around 300/400 euros per month for a room in a shared apartment or a small studio. Social security in France is free for all students (or subject to a small fee of around 100 euros per year). Consult our student guide for more detailed information.

Toulouse hosts more than 14.000 international students, and the University of Toulouse offers dedicated services to facilitate the your arrival -> Toul’Box : customisable packages that you can purchase before arrival, providing you with a bank account, health insurance, sim card... up to looking for an accommodation for you (price range 400-600 EUR per month). -> Welcome Desk : the first place to visit upon arrival, provides support to all prospective students, with a dedicated office for visa applications.  Here is a guide on student housing written by the international relations office of UT Capitole <https://www.ut-capitole.fr/campus/practical-information/accommodation-858871.kjsp?RH=1541674311657>. The University of Toulouse Capitole campus is conveniently located in the city center, with nearby co-working cafés and surrounded by vibrant startup environment.

utterances: What is the job placement rate for graduates of the program?
How successful are graduates at finding jobs?
What kind of career opportunities are available for graduates of the program?
answers: MIAGE graduate students have a unique combination of technical and business skills, which guarantees a high employability in the software or consulting sector. Typical positions held by MIAGE graduate students are business analyst, management and IT consultant, IT project management, BI consultant, big data consultant, software analyst, data analyst, innovative software architect, and software entrepreneur.

MIAGE graduates possess a distinctive blend of technical and business expertise, making them highly sought-after in the software and consulting industries. Some of the common roles occupied by MIAGE alumni include business analyst, management and IT consultant, IT project management, BI consultant, big data consultant, software analyst, data analyst, innovative software architect, and software entrepreneur. They have also completed internships at well-known companies like Capgemini, Continental, Amazon.de, Airbus, LEGOS, Gisaia, R++, Volkswagen China, Sopra Steria, Roamler NL, and Dassault.

utterances: How many semesters do we have?
answers: 4 semesters

The first semester of the program, titled 'Fundamentals' covers a wide range of topics including business intelligence, data analytics, project management, advanced programming, software analysis and design, foreign language (either French or English), soft skills, personal development, research workshop 1, and term project 1. The second semester, 'Towards Innovation' includes courses in business process modeling, artificial intelligence, web services, marketing and entrepreneurship, foreign language, soft skills, personal development, research workshop 2, and an internship or term project 2. The third semester, 'Innovation in IT' delves into innovative data management, cybersecurity, internet of things and web development, advanced topics in artificial intelligence, sustainable information systems, user interface and user experience, strategy and innovation, foreign language, and research workshop 3. The final semester, 'Innovation in Action' is a 5-month internship in a company, followed by a final examination and is worth 20 ECTS.

The program is divided into four semesters, each with a specific focus. The first semester, 'Fundamentals' covers a variety of topics such as business intelligence, data analytics, and programming. The second semester, 'Towards Innovation' includes courses on business process modeling, artificial intelligence, and marketing. The third semester, 'Innovation in IT' focuses on topics such as innovative data management and cybersecurity. The final semester, 'Innovation in Action' is a 5-month internship with a final examination at the end, worth 20 ECTS.

utterances: What is the syllabus of the program
answers: The description of each course can be found in the Syllabus booklet. <https://miage.ut-capitole.fr/medias/fichier/syllabus-2021-22-1-_1647337940227-pdf?ID_FICHE=284273&INLINE=FALSE>

At the Faculty of Information Technologies of University of Toulouse Capitole, we promote innovative teaching methods: capstone projects, flipped classrooms and serious games. We go beyond teaching hard skills, proposing training on soft skills like teamwork and communication skills classes.

utterances: What are the credits for each course?
answers: In semester 1, the course 'Business intelligence' is worth 4 ECTS, 'Data analytics' is worth 4 ECTS, 'Project management and agility' is worth 5 ECTS, 'Advanced programming in Java' is worth 4 ECTS, 'Software analysis and design' is worth 4 ECTS, 'Foreing language (French or English)' is worth 6 ECTS, 'Soft skills and personal development' is worth 4 ECTS, 'Research workshop 1' is worth 2 ECTS, and 'Term project 1' is worth 2 ECTS. In semester 2, the course 'Business process modeling' is worth 5 ECTS, 'Artificial intelligence' is worth 5 ECTS, 'Web services' is worth 5 ECTS, 'Marketing and entrepreneurship' is worth 5 ECTS, 'Foreing language (French or English)' is worth 6 ECTS, 'Soft skills and personal development' is worth 4 ECTS, 'Research workshop 2' is worth 2 ECTS, and 'Internship or term project 2' is worth 3 ECTS. In semester 3, the course 'Innovative data management' is worth 6 ECTS and includes a 'project week', 'Cybersecurity' is worth 2 ECTS, 'Internet of things and web development' is worth 6 ECTS and includes a 'project week', 'Advanced topics in artificial intelligence' is worth 6 ECTS and includes a 'project week', 'Sustainable information systems' is worth 2 ECTS, 'User interface and user experience' is worth 2 ECTS and includes a 'project week', 'Strategy and innovation' is worth 5 ECTS, 'Foreing language (French or English)' is worth 3 ECTS, and 'Research workshop 3' is worth 2 ECTS. In semester 4, students will complete a 5-month 'internship in a company' and take a 'final examination' worth 20 ECTS.

utterances: What are the courses that we will take in the program?
how many courses do we have
answers: The program is divided into four semesters, each with its own focus and objectives. In the first semester, students will cover Fundamentals, taking courses such as Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, Project Management and Agility, Advanced Programming in Java, Software Analysis and Design, and a Foreign Language (French or English). They will also take Soft Skills and Personal Development, Research Workshop 1, and Term Project 1. In the second semester, students will move on to Towards Innovation, taking courses such as Business Process Modeling, Artificial Intelligence, Web Services, Marketing and Entrepreneurship, and a Foreign Language. They will also take Soft Skills and Personal Development, Research Workshop 2, and have the option to choose between an Internship or Term Project 2. In the third semester, students will focus on Innovation in IT, taking courses such as Innovative Data Management, Cybersecurity, Internet of Things and Web Development, Advanced Topics in Artificial Intelligence, Sustainable Information Systems, User Interface and User Experience, and Strategy and Innovation. They will also take a Foreign Language and Research Workshop 3. In the fourth semester, students will complete a 5-month internship in a company and then take the final examination, which is worth 20 ECTS.

utterances: my freind told me i need to ask cumpus france
answers: Depending on your region the process will be different. Send the bot 'Campus France' if you are from Campus France countries, send 'Europe' if you are from Europe and send 'France' if you are French students, or international students holding a French Bachelor degree. Applications consist of CV, grade transcripts, cover letter and evidence of English proficiency (CEF level B2 required).

International students from Campus France countries: apply in the local Campus France office and using the platform Etudes En France <https://pastel.diplomatie.gouv.fr/etudesenfrance/dyn/public/authentification/login.html?codeLangue=EN>. All information on the webpage of the international relation office of the university. <https://www.ut-capitole.fr/preparing-your-arrival/procedures-d-admission/hors-programmes/titulaires-de-diplomes-etrangers-candidats-en-l3-m1-377644.kjsp?RH=1347958954523>
International students from EU or non-Campus France countries: Applications are usually open in March-April on the university portal which will be linked here. Interview and response in April-May.
French students, or international students holding a French Bachelor degree: Applications open in April-May. Interviews and response in June.
Usually the program starts in September, send 'application' to know how to apply to the program.
